page.title: 13TREDEGAR-industrial history
page.content: Tredegar is in a state of decline, decay and possibly disintegration as a once flourishing valley town. What is left reflects the prosperity of the past and what have might been. The reason for the decline are many, but basiclly they fit into the geographical position of the town,- at the heads of the valleys-the economic move of the industry-the economic move of indust to oast and the world wide decline in trade today. The town built its prosrity in the induaal revolution. Before this George Borrow on his travels described the Howy valley as one of the most beautiful in the area. Then iron and coal were found and first the Sirhowy Ironworks belched its fumes of sulphur ad smoke to scar the top end of the valley and then the Tredegar Ironworks opened in the town itself.
